result.execSummary:
The defendant Angaleena N. Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angaleena N. Guzman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angaleena N. Guzman was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions for concurrent counts 1, 2, and 3: Serve 5 days in any Wisconsin county jail, with huber, reporting stayed for up to 60 days. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs suggested by the agent. No contact with the victim, the victim's residence, or the victim's employer. Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

One set of costs have been ordered in this case, however, those have been ordered by the Court payable to the Clerk of Court. Defendant is to pay the costs to the Clerk of Court within 60 days. (The clerk has attached the costs to the domestic-abuse-enhanced Count 3.)

timeConds.notes: With huber. Per the Court's order that jail may be stayed for up to 60 days, it is to begin on or before August 1, 2017. May be served in any WI county jail that will accept.

supervisions.notes:
Per written Stipulation and Order of the Court, order dated August 1, 2018, "The disposition of Ms. Guzman's conviction on count 2 be modified from two years probation to court costs."

Additionally, per the same Order of the Court, "Ms. Guzman's convictions on counts one and three are vacated."

9-26-18 JOC further amended following Clerk's review of court costs imposed in this matter and since paid by the Defendant. Clerk notes that the Defendant paid all costs on the original JOC. Those counts, 1 and 3, have since been vacated. Clerk does not believe Defendant owes for Count 2 as previously stated in the last amended JOC. Defendant's debt obligation in this case has been satisfied. sk
Costs are payable to the Clerk of Court and due by August 1, 2017.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angaleena N. Guzman

Amended JOC & Copy of Criminal Court Record - Forward Time Expired, Return to Sender - Updated address provided by USPS, Resending

Clerk SK has reviewed the financials in this matter, with consideration to the language as stated in the stipulation and orders drafted by counsel and approved by the Court August 1, 2018. Clerk interprets these orders to indicate that the full disposition of vacated counts 1 and 3 were to be replaced with the conviction instead on count 2. As Ms. Guzman did already pay court costs for the now-vacated matters, Clerk SK has removed the costs that were stated on the amended JOC following the vacate order. An amended JOC will be generated with a copy provided to the Defendant and the Richland County Sheriff's Department for their records of the changed JOC.

Ms. Guzman has requested review of financials (court costs) imposed on count 2 following vacate of conviction on counts 1 and 3; she already paid court costs on those matters and does not believe she owes for count 2.
(forwarded to Judge Sharp 7/31)

Atty Harper states parties will be drafting a stipulation and order that will vacate Count 1 and 3, Count 2 to be amended to costs only.  Court will sign order once presented.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. No further evidence presented. DA Harper - State asks for 2 year probation on all counts with conditions of 5 days in jail, cooperation with assessment and treatment programs recommended by agent, no contact with victim/victim's residence/victim's employer; if Defense argues with probation, State will request jail time of 60 days/count 1, 60 days/count 2, 30 days/count 3, to run concurrent. Atty Gardner - Defense asks for 12 month probation, 30 days per charge, imposed and stayed, to run consecutive. If Court requires jail time, Defense requests 60 days to report to either Richland County Jail, Green Lake County Jail, or Columbia County Jail, with huber privileges. Def addresses the court. 

Court orders sentence withheld for 2 years probation, conditions to include: 5 days in any Wisconsin county jail, with huber, and 60 days to report. Defendant must attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs suggested by her agent. No contact with the victim, victim's residence, and victim's employer. One set of costs, payable to the Clerk of Court; 60 dtp. Defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Request from DA's office to reset today's sentencing
Sentencing hearing on June 2, 2017 at 03:30 pm. (notice to attorneys only - interpreters not needed at sentencing)
Testimony of Dane Kanable on Rebuttal in Jury Trial Held 4/6/17

Sentencing hearing on April 21, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Guilty all 3 counts
10 - photo
9 - photo

Day 2. Bailiffs: Komarek and Keys. Security: Logan. Same party appearances as Day 1: Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Trial resumes at 9:05. State rests. Defense calls EM. EM sworn by the clerk and questioned. 9:16, recess. 9:17 - out of presence of jury, Court asks about Def's intent to testify. Court's colloquy with Def re her rights. Back with jury at 9:27, Defense calls Def, AG. AG sworn and questioned.  State begins rebuttal case at 11:01, calling first Deputy D Kanable. DK sworn and questioned. State calls Officer D Pepich. DP sworn and questioned. State calls Lt. B Jones. BJ sworn and questioned. 11:21, out of presence of jury, Defense motions for mistrial. Motion for mistrial denied. Jury instructions conference, out of presence of jury at 12:34. With the jury at 12:50, Court gives jury instructions. Closing arguments - DA/State at 1:23, Atty. G/Defense at 1:47, State's rebuttal at 2:05. 2:15, closing arguments complete, Court provides instructs the jury. Random selection of alternate juror. Bailiffs sworn. 2:22, deliberations begin. Question from the jury noted by the Court at 3:15. Court prepares answer for delivery by the bailiffs to jury. 3:47, verdict received by the Court and read by the clerk - guilty all 3 counts. Court provides final jury instructions. Out of presence of the jury at 3:52, DA asks Def be remanded to custody and sentencing be set for tomorrow. Court will allow Def to remain on bond and sets sentencing for 4/21 at 2. Def's bond is continued.
Bail/Bond Hearing transcript
1-6 - photos

Day 1. Bailiffs: Frye and Fischer. Security: Machotka. Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Panel of 33 jurors sworn for voir dire by the Court, State, and Defense. Voir dire by the Court, DA, and Atty. Gardner. 13 jurors selected and sworn. Juror instructions provided by the Court. State's opening by DA Harper at 11:28. Defense's opening by Atty. Gardner at 11:42. 11:52, out of presence of the jury, review by counsel with the Court of jury instructions. Defense motions for mistrial. DA objects. Motion denied. Lunch recess. 1:05 - State calls Officer E Deitelhoff. ED sworn and questioned on cross, direct, recross and redirect. State calls witness RO. RO sworn and questioned. State calls witness ER. ER sworn and questioned. State calls witness Lt. B Jones. BJ sworn by the clerk and questioned. Out of presence of the jury at 4:17, Court reviews def's stipulations (def is waiving elements 1 and 2 re bail jumping).

Defendant Angaleena Guzman appears in person with Atty Robert Gander. Atty Jennifer Harper appears for the State. This meeting takes place in Judges chambers, outside the presence of the jury.  Court addresses the parties on time constraints and promptness with the trial. Court distributes jury instructions and verdict forms. Court states he was able to find one criminal conviction of said victim, Richland Count case 15CT29. Atty Gardner states he believes there are two cases, one being in Iowa County under an AKA, 14CM144. Court states he does show two criminal convictions for the victim. Atty Gardner states issue with witness, AR, and a video that shes in with the victim and asks for clarification from Atty Harper on her testimony. Atty Harper states theyll be using just what witness AR saw, no video will be offered. Atty Gardner states he is fine with that. Atty Harper states in the instructions it does not state certain language to the jurors and asks the Court to address the jurors with these new instructions. Atty Gardner agrees to change. Court will direct jurors on new language in instruction. Nothing further from the defense and the state.

Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by phone means for Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman not in court. Review of estimated trial length, witness lists, jury instructions, motions including witness sequestration and priors. State has motioned to add additional criminal damage charge. Court notes that there will be the same 3 counts as originally charged.

clerk left a phone message 3/30/17 for Atty. Gardner as he attempted to fax a motion in limine and witness list 3/29/17; filing came through only in part; clerk asks that Atty. Gardner resubmit this filing, doing so electronically

Final pre-trial on April 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Final status. Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by phone means for Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman. Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman not in court.Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gardner states there will not be a plea. Court will proceed with the 2-day trial; 4 strikes; 13 jurors (12 plus 1 alternate; 21 jurors in the box for selection). Atty Harper states her witnesses and will be adding another witness list, a deputy from the RC Jail. Atty Harper states she has not received a witness list from defense counsel. Atty Gardner asks for 48 hours to file his witness list. So ordered. Atty Gardner will be filing a standard motion of limine with the witness list. Court will not accept plea agreements from this point on.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

from Clerk to the Court and trial counsel re interpreter booking and cancellation policy; request from the Clerk to move the FPT to a date no later than March 27th

Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by phone means for Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman in court.  Atty. Guzman states that the Def still wants the jury trial; says that State has provided all discovery; Defense not making any more requests for discovery.  DA states that interpreters will be needed for the victim.  Clerk notes that interpreters have cancellation policies; inquires as to who will be responsible for repaying county for this costs if trial folds short of the required cancellation policy.  Court states that, if that happens, Court will make determination as to which side was at fault and may assess those costs.  Court inquires re witnesses.  DA requests Atty. G's witness list by end of the week.  Atty. G indicates filing of motions.  DA states that, if motions and indiated additional discovery of the defense change the complexion of the case, additional scheduling may be needed.
